page.title: 04ROSEWALL COTTAGE,LETWELL
page.content: {Rosewall Cottage}is made up of three different workmen's cottages which were a butchers, a farmers and a blacksmiths.On the end there was a cowshed.It is approximately four hundred years old and is on maps in {Mary Tudor's}time.{Rosewall Cottage is on the border between {South {Yorkshire}and {Nottinghamshire.}There is a row of out buildings that used to be an out door toilet and pigsty. Some of{Rosewall Cottage} is under ground. Levels of ground were different four hundred years ago.At the entrance to the gate there is a well which was where the villagers got their water from. In the house there are some oak beams that are from ships.The house is a{listed building}which means they can't alter it without permission from the Department of the Environment.
